III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was touched on the backside by a staff when they were
being moved to their room. Law Enforcement was dispatched to
the facility due to the youth being suicidal.
Investigation Officer was interviewed face to face on May 30, 2024, and
reported Youth A has made many allegations that law
enforcement has investigated without having findings. Officer
reported Youth A made the comment but did not provide any
specifics about the allegation. Officer stated Youth A has made
allegations Officer was raping him and Officer told him the body
cam was on and Youth A said it felt like he was being raped when
the handcuffs were being applied. Officer stated it is difficult
because Youth A makes a lot of allegations, and each one must
be investigated but so far there has not been any truth to the
allegations.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 30,
2024, and reported Youth A was currently at the hospital for a
mental health evaluation. Director stated he was not sure if
there was a time Staff 1 was alone with Youth A or not. Director
stated Staff 1 could have been assigned Youth A’s one on one
staff and if that occurred there would be documentation. Director
reported Youth A has made allegations in the past about different
staff that have been investigated with no findings.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 30,
2024. Staff 1 reported he was assigned as the one-to-one staff
2

for Youth A on either 05/25/24 or 05/26/24 in the morning. Staff 1
stated he arrived approximately 6:00am to Unit 2 and was alone
with Youth A until approximately 9:00am when Staff 2 came to the
unit to assist with Youth A. Staff 1 described Youth A sleeping
when Staff 1 arrived on shift at 6:00am and not waking up until
approximately 7:30am. Staff 1 reported Youth A had been moved
to Unit 2 away from his peers because the night before Youth A
took a pipe and went after his peer, then broke out windows with
the pipe. Staff 1 stated Youth A woke up and was agitated, pacing
the unit, and threatening to get to his peers. Staff 1 stated he
called Staff 2 for assistance and shortly after Staff 2 arrived on the
unit and Youth A ran out the door. Staff 1 reported he was only
alone with Youth A for an hour after Youth A woke up. Staff 1
denied touching Youth A on his backside or accidently getting too
close and touching Youth A at any time. Staff 1 reported this was
the only time he was alone with Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 30,
2024. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 called for assistance with Youth A
because Youth A was escalated. Staff 2 described arriving to the
unit and talking with Youth A about Youth A moving back to his
original unit. Staff 2 stated he spoke with Youth A about the
expectations and how to properly interact with his peers. Staff 2
reported Youth A continued to yell, pace the unit, threatened to
punch Staff 1 then threw a chair at Staff 1 and ran out the door of
the unit. Staff 2 stated once outside Youth A broke a window, went
around the building and started picking up rocks. Staff 2
described Staff 1 standing outside, away from Youth A watching
the situation. Staff 2 reported Officer arrived and started walking
toward Youth A, Staff 1, and Staff 2. Staff 2 stated Youth A was
going to be transported to the hospital for an evaluation and when
he was getting into the ambulance, Youth A told Officer, Staff 1
touched his bottom when he was leaving the unit. Staff 2 denied
ever seeing Staff 1 touch Youth A in any way. Staff 2 described
Youth A running out the door of the unit and Staff 1 standing by
the door. Staff 2 reported he did not see Staff 1 touch Youth A at
all when Youth A ran out the door. Staff 2 stated, “Staff 1 would
never do that, he’s old and it’s not his character at all.” Staff 2
reported Youth A has made allegations against staff in the past
where licensing has had to investigate. Staff 2 stated he does not
believe any of Youth A’s allegations have been true.
Youth A was interviewed via Teams on June 5, 2024. Youth A
denied any staff at the facility ever touching him. Youth A
reported he could not recall telling Officer that Staff 1 touched his
backside or bottom. Youth A reported he could not recall if he
3

was ever alone with Staff 1. Youth A stated he did not have any
concerns with the staff at the facility.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 5/26/24 in Unit 2 was reviewed on May 30, 2024.
Video shows Staff 1 alone on Unit 2 with Youth A from 6:20am
until 8:06am and then again from 8:07am until 8:31am. Youth A is
seen pacing the unit, pushing a desk, and running out the door.
The only time Staff 1 is seen close to Youth A is when Youth A
runs by Staff 1 out the door. Staff 1 is standing near the door as
Youth A pushes the door open and runs out. It does not appear
Staff 1 touches Youth A at any time when Youth A runs by him out
the door. Staff 1 is not viewed on camera touching Youth A at any
time during the assigned one-to-one shift.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record for
Staff 1.
• Behavior and Activity Log for Youth A dated 5/26/24: Log
entries are consistent with Staff 1 and Staff 2 interviews.
There were no other times Staff 1 was assigned as the
one-to-one to Youth A.
• Unit Shift Log entry dated 5/26/24: Log entry is consistent
with Staff 1 and Staff 2’s description of Youth A’s behavior
and running out the door on the unit.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review, Staff 1 was not seen touching Youth
A on his backside.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
